intro: Dicliptera humbertii, commonly known as the Humbert's dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest understory. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
